website_summaries.verdict: It's always worth reexamining technological features we take for granted, but even if you like Microsoft's new approach to the spacebar, the Sculpt Comfort Keyboard needs some streamlining before it merits a recommendation.
pros: An alternative take on the spacebar, a removable wrist rest, and Windows 8-specific hot keys give the Microsoft Sculpt Comfort Keyboard a robust set of features for its price
cons: Mushy typing and the oversize spacebar make the Sculpt Comfort Keyboard feel imprecise and cumbersome

customer_reviews.title: Good but quirky.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is great. It has helped with my hands being positioned in away that helps my carpal tunnel not to be aggravated so bad. The ONLY con is that in order to use some functions like the refresh F2 button you have to switch this toggle but then if you need to use for example the PRTSCN (screen copy) option you have to switch the toggle back. It's frustrating because when you are doing customer service you don't really have time to talk type and switch a toggle back and forth.
customer_reviews.author: Draye

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and easy to use all day while working.  When its picking up all key-strokes this thing is a no brainer for me.
customer_reviews.text: Love the key layout, and I used the hell out of this keyboard before ultimately replacing it with the "Comfort Key 3000" also from Microsoft. I found I was missing keystrokes on a regular basis, and finally decided I couldn't keep just hoping that didn't happen. I would have paid for a Wired Version of this keyboard in a hot minute. I *love* the way this thing feels, and I type more or less all day. The missed-keystrokes issue was, unfortunately, kind of a deal breaker for me.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Prior

customer_reviews.title: An unexpected find at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I can't think of another keyboard at a similar price range with the build quality of this keyboard, or the level of comfortability. The waviness of the keyboard (there's probably a more technical word, but oh well) is not as extreme as some others I've seen, such as Logitech. I didn't need a keyboard that looked like a tumor was growing in it, so thankfully this Sculpt Comfort has a curvature to it without going overboard. The keys have a soft click to them and the keystrokes are very even as opposed to the down-or-up chiclet keyboards on laptops and most cheap keyboards. I'm happy with this unit and hopefully it'll last me many years
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Lopes

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: As a computer tech professional, I've used my share of keyboards. At home, I used a Logitech Wave keyboard for about 10 years. When all of the keys started sticking, I looked for a replacement. One professional review about this Microsoft Sculpt keyboard said it negatively was the La-Z-Boy of keyboards... too mushy, etc. However, I've owned a La-Z-Boy at home for over 30 years and I love it :) So after a few months now with this Microsoft keyboard, I can highly recommend it. Indeed there is limited key travel, but very comfortable. The extra-soft palm rest is especially nice, compared to others. So go to a computer/office supply store and try this one out before buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Poe

customer_reviews.title: Love the keyboard tilt with legs in front to eliminate bending of wrist.
customer_reviews.text: Good unit for the price. Typing the review on it. Only drawback is that the function keys are not very useful for my needs. This keyboard has foldable legs in front, not the back. THIS IS GOOD. Having legs in the back tilts the keyboard up in the back, so you must bend your wrists. Tilting the keyboard in the front allows typing with straight wrists. First keyboard I've seen this way. I tried it both ways, legs out, and legs in. Legs out seemed to be a bit wierd at first. However, after switching back and forth during the first day, legs out won hands down. Much more comfortable way for me to type
customer_reviews.author: Nannie McPhee

customer_reviews.title: Have keyboard, will travel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take with me when traveling, to use with my Surface Pro tablet/laptop when I need to get serious work done (i.e. a lot of typing). It works with the Pro with no problems and I love that you can detach the palm rest to make it more compact. I had hoped it would be a little smaller than it ended up being, and would have gladly sacrificed the number pad for greater portability. It's not easy to find a small ergonomic keyboard but this will work. the feel is good and the keys are responsive. If I could chop off the three inches or so that the keypad adds, it would be close to perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Shinder

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard, but my mistake.
customer_reviews.text: I have an old wrist injury which makes it very difficult for me to use the typical "straight" keyboard. I've had several ergonomic keyboards that work well. I purchased this one to replace one that had a few broken keys. However, I didn't realize it is not a split curve. Because of that, I found it very difficult to keep my fingers placed correctly. But that was my error. The keyboard itself is good quality, keys feel nice, the action is good and quiet. If you just want a curved keyboard and don't need the split type, this will work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A. Hines

customer_reviews.title: I got this in January, and despite some of ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this in January, and despite some of it's idiosyncrasies, I turned out liking it. However, it died and the cost to ship it for warranty repair/replacement is just too high--so into the pile of computer junk it goes. Apparently the "dongle" stopped working (I have a USB hub that shows when something is working/not-working or connected/not connected). Now I'll have to just go shopping.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Nelson, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Not the successor of the Natural Ergonomic Keyboard 4000
customer_reviews.text: I use the Natural Ergonomic 4000 and was hoping Microsoft release an update which fixes some of the issues I had with it, namely space bar, size and key response. This keyboard is a smaller and has an improved space bar. But the palm rest is quite in adequate in size, keys are not quite responsive and the biggest downside is the function keys are smaller and harder to press and have a manual toggle switch between function keys and special functions. If Microsoft can make the palm rest a bit larger, add some more travel to the keys, make it a bit more responsive/clicky, improve the function keys and restore the back height adjustment, it will be great.
customer_reviews.author: Nemo

customer_reviews.title: My favorite keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th keyboard I have bought in ten years, and it is probably going to be the last. The slight curve feels really natural, it isn't as exaggerated as most ergonomic keyboards. Just a little contour to help keep your wrists in a healthy position. The thing that really sells this keyboard for me is the split spacebar. I had originally bought myself one for home, but after only two weeks of using it, the muscle memory of "left thumb to backspace" was so ingrained that I had to order one for the office too. I hope to never go back to using a non-split spacebar.
customer_reviews.author: J.Tenneyson

customer_reviews.title: comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: Decent battery life, comfortable to use, but it's only issue is the F buttons. There's actually a toggle switch all the way in the upper right corner, and that will switch it between an F function or the volume controls/ settings menu/ etc. What was wrong with that 'Fn' button by the Ctrl & Alt buttons you used to hold instead? At this point, might as well reach the extra 3 inches for the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Spring

customer_reviews.title: ... use at work(replace a wired Dell keyboard) and I like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard to use at work(replace a wired Dell keyboard) and I like it a lot, the padding is great if you type for long periods of time, the keys are much less noisy than my other keyboard, I tried the delete functionality on the space bar but apparently their research did not include users like me, since I use my left thumb for the space bar, but you can disable it and it will stay like that, I haven't found that you will turn it back on accidentally I will be buying another one to replace my keyboard at home.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Dead keys in a year - not worth the investment unless you want to put out 50-70 dollars a year for this
customer_reviews.text: Ordered on January 22, 2016 as verified by Amazon Keys along the top of the keyboard from 1 - 7 are dead Unable to use shift to activate the symbols and unable to login to work sites that require the characters
customer_reviews.author: PtahBaphomet

customer_reviews.title: Nice transitional keyboard into ergonomic style
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard feels great, and its not too different feeling from a regular keyboard. I have carpel tunnel like symptoms, and this helps me keep typing longer without getting a numb feeling in my hand. The function buttons are useful and work really well on windows. I dislike the switch to change it to the F keys, but I am getting used to it. I have yet to enable the backspace spacebar, but I will give it a shot and update this.
customer_reviews.author: FikeMernandez

customer_reviews.title: I like my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Other than the 2-3" long USB receiver, I like my purchase. Connection was easy and immediate once I inserted the USB receiver (using a Microsoft Surface Pro 3). And I think I'll really like the split space bar with the backspace option once I reprogram myself to using my left thumb to backspace instead of reaching to the top right corner to backspace. It's not as portable but II like using this external, full-size keyboard much better than the Type 3 keyboard I purchased with the SP.
customer_reviews.author: J.A.K.

customer_reviews.title: Backspace at your thumbtip is a revolutionary idea; love this keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. I bought one for work and liked it so much that I bought another for home. The space-bar/backspace function is now a must-have for me; I find myself trying to backspace on other people's keyboards, and end up inputting a space. Very easy to switch functions, as well; the switch is at the top of the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Neff

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard - slim and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: It's a great keyboard with a great feel - my only issue is that you have a switch to go between regular functions and the F1-12 keys... I normally don't use the special functions but PrtScn is one of them so I end up having to switch back and forth. I'm in IT, so I use F1-12 quite often still and would prefer to not have to switch between two modes. That said I have a lot of wrist strain from regular keyboards that pretty much went away instantly when I put this on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: T. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Run away!
customer_reviews.text: Really didn't like it. I've been a Microsoft Ergo keyboard user for as long as they've offered them, and this is the worst one ever. It's not the same as the others were, and it's uncomfortable. I put this in the closet after a couple of hours of use and went and bought the newer Microsoft Sculpt Keyboard which I *adore*!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Terman

customer_reviews.title: Nice and quiet
customer_reviews.text: I needed a quiet keyboard quiet enough to not be heard when typing while using my speaker phone. I take notes with OneNote and most keyboard 'click' too loudly, especially the space bar. This one is as quite as I could find. I would rather have had a wired version, but hopefully this one will not go through batteries too quickly. Note: Keyboard does not have a "CapsLock" indicator. This is taking a little getting used to, but does not warrant a ding on stars in my opinion...
customer_reviews.author: D. McBride

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is the best keyboard I've ever used. I love that the space bar doubles as a backspace key, that is my FAVORITE feature! I type a lot for work and that makes it so nice! It is very comfortable to use, the pad at the base of the keyboard is nice and I like the little feet on the bottom that flip up to angle the keyboard if you want to. I'd highly recommend this to someone who types a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Shauna

customer_reviews.title: I found that annoying and promptly returned the keys
customer_reviews.text: If you are a programmer (or otherwise rely on the Alt, Ctrl hot key combinations) this is not the keyboard for you. I can't believe many hardware companies are redefining the key positions and expect us to get used to it. Alt keys are not off by 1 cm making it difficult to reach with your thumb. I found that annoying and promptly returned the keys. The keys are not great either.
customer_reviews.author: Raja

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable keyboard. I suffered from tennis elbow for several months, have been trying different ergonomic products, mouse, keyboard, chair, desk. Now I'm using this keyboard and it's been very helpful to ease my pain. It's light and very easy to move around. The keys are responsive and have the right amount of sound, because I like to have some feedback when typing. Good product!
customer_reviews.author: JRow

customer_reviews.title: Love Love Love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this key board, it has helped with the tendonitis, and arthritis in my wrists tremendously. The only reason I gave it four stars because it wasn't compatible with the iMac, I had to search for separate programming to download in order to make it compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle A.

customer_reviews.title: bought 2 and both broke within a month
customer_reviews.text: First of the USB FOB is paired to the keyboard and can not be replaced if anything goes wrong. It sticks out an inch plus so it is easy for it to get bumped. I had one get bumped and one just stop working I called MS Support, there solution was to buy a new keyboard. I love the keyboard, but I now have two nice keyboards with no way for them to talk to the computer. Twice burned - went and bought a Logitech keyboard instead. I like the MS one better, but I can't afford to replace it every couple of weeks because of the faulty fobs.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Tudhope

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea, but unresponsive
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this keyboard as it is the only one that I've found that incorporates the Windows8 charm shortcuts, and that's really helpful on a desktop. But I've had a huge amount of input lag, especially after the system wakes from sleep. I have quite a few wireless devices, so maybe that's it, but the keyboard is essentially unusable. I also agree that the toggle switch is annoying, the keyboard is for a new computer build and having to remember to flip the switch to get the fn keys (to get into BIOS) is a pain. Pros: Charm keys Detachable wrist rest Cons Awful wireless performance Toggle switch
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M

customer_reviews.title: great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great Keyboard and after years of using a normal keyboard, I'm not switching back. My hands do not hurt anymore as is very comfortable. Only ugly thing is the big USB dongle, but apart from that, this is great. I've had it for 8 months and normal battery is still running.
customer_reviews.author: Juegos86

customer_reviews.title: One of the best I've ever used, and I've used a LOT
customer_reviews.text: After my last wireless keyboard from microsoft died I tried some logitech ones and then found this one. It is a little weird at first glance but really is designed well for a speed typer. I also like the fact that the spacebar (which is split in two) can be used as a backspace as well. Once you get used to that you pick up a few WPM.
customer_reviews.author: mjmd

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy it again
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for almost 2 years now, most used keys have rubbed off (e, r, t, a, s, d, c, n). Love that it's ergonomic yet low-profile, fits easily on a sliding keyboard tray.
customer_reviews.author: TMSTCYR08

customer_reviews.title: Decent keyboard, but not an ergonomic powerhouse
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell much difference with this keyboard and a regular keyboard, but it works....so I will keep it. The contoured design isn't that significant so it's practically like using a regular keyboard. If you are looking for a good ergonomic keyboard this isn't it. Spend extra money and buy a keyboard with well defined ergonomic contours.
customer_reviews.author: Kenia K

customer_reviews.title: Hey, I love it, it's great . . .
customer_reviews.text: and my grandson broke it two days after I got it (as in dropped it and stepped on it broke it while dancing to an MP3). My daughter replaced it with something not as nice so I'll be getting another one lone of these days. I did have some trouble with the different key arrangement for something but I adapted in a day and now can't remember what was different. So, how much of a problem could it be?
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Hume

customer_reviews.title: not great
customer_reviews.text: This was too big for my workspace--it made it so my trackpad had to be way over to the right, which was uncomfortable. I also do not like that there is no light on the Caps Lock key so you have no idea when it is on or off. Other than that it is well constructed, but I don't think it is very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Papalios

customer_reviews.title: While takes some getting use to I do like the touch of this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: While takes some getting use to I do like the touch of this keyboard. One of of negatives I see in using for about 5 hours after opening and installing. I do not have a "light to show that Num lock or cap loc is on?? I am "old school" and personally like printed instructions or at a minimum a "link" in the box that sends me to a website to learn how to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mlu

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great
customer_reviews.text: I have two computers at work and the standard keyboard was hurting my wrists so I tried this one, it is not great, it is just good. Good enough not to return it, but I would not get another one. I have this on the computer that I use for testing only not for typing documents, not sure I would have kept it if I had to type on it all day. It is odd that it will not tilt forward, it only tilts backwards.
customer_reviews.author: Alesia J. Sipes

customer_reviews.title: Great, but 1 downside.
customer_reviews.text: Once I've had time to get used to it I love it. It's very comfortable and I didn't like the gap in the Ergonomic Keyboard. I've been using it for a few weeks now and I'd recommend it to anyone. There is 1 issue though. I enjoyed the Comfort Keyboard but I wanted the Ergonomic mouse. So I bought them separately and they need 2 receivers which is foolish. My comfort level at my desk now is worth it though.
customer_reviews.author: Dragon archer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is easily the best Microsoft keyboard I have owned. The wireless communication is good and the usb transmitter is small. The keys have a good feel. The split design naturally fits your hands. The wrist rest is also very comfortable. Highly recommend. Just make sure to shop around as in there is a wide price range. You can also buy this in a set with a mouse.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Love this but...
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these. Why two? After about a month the USB transmitter part died. I bought a replacement at a local store and hope one day microsoft will get themselves together enough to fix the issue of having each keyboard belong with one USB. Logitechs all work together. Get with the program. Also, this keyboard was to replace an older microsoft wireless keyboard (which I loved even more!) but the USB part on that one died after several years.
customer_reviews.author: A. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Wrist Support / Releif
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. It gives me just enough relief in my wrists without having to learn how to use the split-key keyboards. I love it. Also, this keyboard has a really soft wrist bar, and rather than the keyboard lifting up from the back, this one has the tabs underneath so it lifts from the front, also helping with wrist support.
customer_reviews.author: KK0101

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ergonomic keyboard and I love it. I bought it because my wrist and fingers were hurting from processing at a computer 8 hours a day. It was very easy to get used to and has a nice natural feel. It is not bulky and takes up the same amount of space as my other keyboard that came with the computer. I am a big fan and have received compliments about it as we'll. I highly recommend this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: JessB

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend with the warning about the missing caps lock light
customer_reviews.text: Decent keyboard at good price. Ergonomic design. I like the back space bar. One very aggravating aspect: there is no Caps lock light. You just have to screw up then re-do whatever you wrote. Or have some component of Photoshop not work. Tiresome.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Dennis

customer_reviews.title: It is not really Apple compatible
customer_reviews.text: The product is actually good, however, I bought 2 at the same time and both suddenly stopped working on my MacBook Pro, one after the other. It works fine for a few months then it just dies. Microsoft technical assistance is terrible, they do everything to try to escape responsibility, on top of not being knowledgeable at all about compatibility between the two. If you do not have a PC, do not purchase this, it will not work and you'll throw your money in the bin.
customer_reviews.author: Krishna Brunoni

customer_reviews.title: Solid keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this keyboard for about six months now and I'd have to say I'm very pleased with it. My only complaint is that is seems to not respond far more often that I'd like - if I lock or leave my computer and return to it 10 minutes later, I have to hit the keyboard a few times before it will respond.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Awkward
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard has a front-side height adjustment which feels awkward to me. The key placement is awkward as well and has taken some getting used to. I often hit the caps lock when I'm reaching for the tab key because they are close together and higher than usual. It's just not a very comfortable keyboard and I have been using a sculpted keyboard prior to this one.
customer_reviews.author: lacytoo

customer_reviews.title: This was an excellent purchase. I love my new keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This was an excellent purchase. I love my new keyboard. It is comfortable to use, has quiet clicks that I like so I can tell I did hit the key. The letters are very easy to see and I was worried because I have focus problems with my eyes. Wonderful keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but compact
customer_reviews.text: I switched from the Microsoft Comfort Desktop keyboard, and I found this keyboard to be as comfortable, but with a smaller footprint on my desk. As a bonus, the function keys (especially escape) are more accessible, but for some reason I have trouble with the lowest row of keys (like alt and ctrl). I'm sure it will work out once I'm used to the slightly different layout.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wu

customer_reviews.title: Fits the bill
customer_reviews.text: I am a virtual assistant and type a lot on a daily basis. I wanted something comfortable, compact, and simple. This fit the bill and I have had it for a couple weeks now without having to change the battery in the keyboard so I am happy. This is the best keyboard purchase I have made : )
customer_reviews.author: Jess Woo

customer_reviews.title: Comfy keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard to replace the keyboard that came included in my Acer all in one. I like the curve of the keyboard, as it helps your fingers fall naturally. The only thing that bothers me is the fact that the risers are on the bottom half (near the wrist rest) instead of the top. The split spacebar is a nifty little touch as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dommie P

customer_reviews.title: Feels great, works well below par
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is by far the most comfortable and natural fitting for my hands I have every used. But, unfortunately, the rest of it is sub par. The keys take extra pressure to activate, meaning you need a much slower, and much heavier pace. Many times I look up to see letters missing from my sentences because I did not press hard enough. There is also no way to tell if caps lock, or other keyboard toggles are on/off. Sounds like a small thing, but it's not when you keep seeing all caps and such a lot. It's really too bad, because it would have been a great keyboard. To many cheep flaws.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Weindel

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1.5 years
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard. I loved it. But it broke within 1.5 years - several number keys stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Twain

customer_reviews.title: There is no indicator light at all, so you ...
customer_reviews.text: There is no indicator light at all, so you can't tell if Caps Lock or Num lock is on. Key is slightly smaller than my previous real ergonomic keyboard, but my previous one cost more than $100 and this is less than $30. I should not complain.
customer_reviews.author: EW

customer_reviews.title: Low profile version of ergonomic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: good keyboard comfortable and functions well with windows 8. One point there is no way to incline the keyboard towards you (that is the back of the keyboard higher than the front). The only feet raise the keyboard from the front sloping towards the back...this seems weird to be but perhaps there is some ergonomic research that I'm not aware of. I use it flat and it is a good product. If you want the sculpt/ergonomic design in a low profile format this is great
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard. Bought one for home and the office. Love the price, the responsiveness and the comfort of the wrist support and wave of the design. The space bar back space key is a real plus and a treat rolled into one and definitely sealed the deal in my decision to make this my newest go to keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: The Critic

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for smaller hands and for carpel tunnel. A smaller keyboard that takes up less space. The keys are not "clicky" making it great for late nights when you don't want to keep others awake.
customer_reviews.author: LuLu

customer_reviews.title: You will get aerobic exercise using this keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: This one takes some time to get used to using. The keys are far apart and I can not type fast as I must move my hands all over the board. That also eliminates the need for the nice wrist rest as you can not rest any part of your hands to make the board useful.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Fiona

customer_reviews.title: Great design and solidly built, but not for larger hands
customer_reviews.text: Great design, but doesn't work well for larger hands. the keys seem to be too close, or the design doesn't allow for larger hands. If you have a L or XL hand, this may not be for you. Its a shame because I liked the design and that it was solidly built and wireless. If it was slightly larger, would have been a winner.
customer_reviews.author: CameraGuy

customer_reviews.title: Worst keyboard ever conceived
customer_reviews.text: Worst keyboard ever conceived. Most of the time you can press 1 key and wall away for 2 or 3 minutes then come back to press the next key. Other times you can be typing a way and suddenly it will stop showing what you are typing. Wait a couple of minutes and the letters will eventually show up. If I could give it less than one star I would
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Melvin McCarroll, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality and Value
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard feels great to type with. It is angled just enough to help. The wrist pad is well integrated so that it feels like one piece. The overall design is trim and not to tall so that I can close my pullout keyboard tray. Using the legs that tilt the keyboard away from you is more helpful to alleviate stress on my arms than I would have thought.
customer_reviews.author: Grant D.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is a very comfortable keyboard. I love the placement of the feet adjustment clips and my wrists are loving it too. Good travel on the keys, hushed typing, I don't mind using the Function/Charms toggle at all. I wouldn't say this is the hardcore gamers ideal keyboard, but I don't have a single complaint from the games I've played on it. For general purpose computing/day-to-day use, this is a fantastic keyboard. If you've got Windows 8, then this keyboard is a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Strattao

customer_reviews.title: Keys Don't Respond Well
customer_reviews.text: Typing feels comfortable and 'buttery' - feels good. But keys do not respond well. Sometimes you have to press hard, press again and press more because characters are not showing on the monitor. Then, you say, maybe the usb is not connected good. You try typing again, then voila, it is working again.
customer_reviews.author: Juan dela cruz

customer_reviews.title: Nice Ergo Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Nice keyboard. Needed a new ergonomic one so bought this one based on price/Microsoft name/reviews. Has a really cool feature where the backspace button is also available as part of the space bar (it's split into two buttons: space and backspace). Makes typing comfortable and I'm much quicker using this.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Cusick

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a sweet upgrade from my last "comfort" keyboard. I particularly like its svelt sizing and configuration. Since I also frequently use a laptop, this keyboard makes for an easy transition between my desktop and laptop. Overall, I've been very happy with this. It's responsive and the keys provide a nice snap.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan D Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got it...
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my old Microsoft Comfort Curve 5000 after it met an untimely death by spilled soda. This is a solid keyboard, both in function and feel. There is nothing about this that feels flimsy, almost to the point of being blocky. The spacebar is kind of odd, and I found myself using my left thumb while playing MMOs, so I never converted it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Henson

customer_reviews.title: This is the best keyboard I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: This is the best keyboard I have ever used. the wrist-rest is comfortable and perfectly placed. The keyboard itself is fast to type on and also REALLY easy to customize. Microsoft makes great accessories, even the people who don't like their software might agree. I love my keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Public

customer_reviews.title: This is quite possibly the WORST keyboard ever
customer_reviews.text: This is quite possibly the WORST keyboard ever. Hoping it would be like the last ergonomic keyboard I purchased, i purchased this one. However, it is not, the keys do not line up correctly cause extremely lowered typing speed and HIGH level of errors. Do not buy this, its not worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: AliceInWonderland

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if this is a computer issue or related to the keyboard but it is very annoying. Other than that I like all the other ..
customer_reviews.text: My only issue is that it tends to "freeze" for short periods of time randomly and I have to go and re download the software. Not sure if this is a computer issue or related to the keyboard but it is very annoying. Other than that I like all the other aspects.
customer_reviews.author: JPSBaltimore

customer_reviews.title: Very nicely designed
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. I have spilled coffee in it and it still performs beautifully. Plus I love the ergonomic design and the cushion. I would definitely buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Rena

customer_reviews.title: Excellent portable ergonomic keyboard from Microsoft!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent keyboard whose battery has long outlasted that of my older Microsoft mouse! My purchase was inspired by how much I had loved my Microsoft Ergonomic 4000, and needed something a bit more portable for my workstation away from home.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft knows how to make a keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The reason I gave this a 5 star is because it has great quality at a great price. What I liked about this product? It does what it suppose to the pad that I rest my wrists on. I would recommend this product to anyone who types on a desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. HairDon'tCare

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I like thin keyboard that does not require me raise my wrists too much, and this one is thin enough (could be better/thinner). I like it's not too curvy. One drawback on this is Ctrl-V is kind of far compared to flat/regular keyboards. I like the large Delete key so I do not hitting Insert instead. I don't like the switch to toggle between F keys and Feature functions (sounds, Play, etc.) The problem is Print Screen is on the opposite toggle with F keys. I need both in daily work. I prefer tic-tac keys instead soft and quite one this keyboard provides.
customer_reviews.author: V. Vu

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard for the Price Hands Down
customer_reviews.text: I actually prefer this keyboard over several more expensive keyboards out there. This is the perfect keyboard for the typical office worker. I would highly recommend. Touch sensitivity is also great - does not have that plasticky feel like the LG. Is more smooth and feedback on your fingers is great.
customer_reviews.author: JRCPA

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase - Love this Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love my keyboard, it is very comfortable, I like the split space bar, the pad to rest on is really nice and I like having the tilt in the other direction than what's standard, my wrists are more flat.
customer_reviews.author: KKHanke

customer_reviews.title: comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable. Almost my entire work day is spent typing up reports so a comfortable keyboard is a pretty nice improvement. It does take a bit to get used to location of the keys with the odd shape but it's nothing terrible.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: To small, special function key is not friendly and uncomfortable, I've been using Logitech for years and change to microsoft because of ergonomic but I'm really dissapointed. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Enio Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for a few months with no issues. Its comfortable to use and my wrists thank me for it. Connection is good and I have never had any issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Austin M.

customer_reviews.title: The keyboard is not very comfortable to type on
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is not very comfortable to type on. It has riser legs in the front and not the back where they traditionally are. I have had to prop the keyboard up to make it comfortable to type on. Wasn't the best keyboard i have owned.
customer_reviews.author: arier38

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Scult Comfort Keyboard - Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is a very comfortable keyboard. It takes a day or two to get used to it versus whatever other type keyboard you are using, and then I found that I could type very quickly. It is also very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard. Ergonomic and light. I used it to replace a Logitech MK 550 keyboard which stopped working after three months. This is a excellent keyboard. Use it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Barrett Withers

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: We received this keyboard and two letters were in incorrect spots and it didn't work correctly,
customer_reviews.author: Ke Erbs

customer_reviews.title: That the keyboard works!
customer_reviews.text: Many keys stick and repeat the letter many times and sometimes when a key is pressed it didn't show! Waste of good money.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Best add-on to my Surface RT
customer_reviews.text: I use this keyboard to type papers for school on my Surface RT. It is perfect, way better than those tiny keyboards they give you with the Surface, and it is more comfortable. A++
customer_reviews.author: Sheena

customer_reviews.title: but it seems to be working just great!
customer_reviews.text: The little feet underneath would drop down in front of keyboard so it's hard to type without adjusting. but it seems to be working just great!

customer_reviews.title: Connects quick and easy, comfortable to use and allows me to have ...
customer_reviews.text: Connects quick and easy, comfortable to use and allows me to have my laptop far away connected to my tv and with a wireless mouse (one I bought separately) I can make my computer an entertainment center easily.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Defrancis

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: Thia is a really nice keyboard. It is easy totype with and it doesnt hurt your wrist after using it for a long time. I would definitely recommend this keyboad and i would buy it again.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: This product was a waste of my money then it cost me the price of the item to package it and return postage the item.

customer_reviews.title: this is a good low-price option
customer_reviews.text: i replaced my old keyboard with this. If you are on a keyboard all day, you'll want something else but for most of us, this is a good low-price option.
customer_reviews.author: APrimeanon

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome super comfortable keyboard. I always used to prop up my keyboard but I found this one works wonders! No problems with in in 3 months of use at work.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kadin

customer_reviews.title: Good product! Would not have expected the Microsoft keyboard ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product! Would not have expected the Microsoft keyboard to be so smooth. Would buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: mroxana

customer_reviews.title: This is a great keyboard (the pictures here don't give it justice) Besides ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard (the pictures here don't give it justice) Besides being extremely comfortable, it is beautifully made. You will never go back to a regular keyboard, the (upside) curve is fantastic. The keys are not close together or wide apart... just in the perfect distance from one another.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Love this Keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Love this Keyboard!! It's quieter, smaller, and less expensive than it's competitors. Just wanted to add that I have used two other ergonomic keyboards and like this one the best.
customer_reviews.author: J. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very comfortable, good quality, compact - doesn't take up a lot of space on the desk.
customer_reviews.author: Rockne Von Taylor

customer_reviews.title: This is great. It has just the right shape
customer_reviews.text: This is great. It has just the right shape. I t's sculpted, but not too much.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: comfy for power typing
customer_reviews.text: takes a little getting used to if you've never typed on an ergonomic keyboard before. the kickstands underneath are counter-intuitively placed on the palm side but actually makes for very comfortable resting position. this kb has a soft touch, and the split space bar allows you to program it for delete which is cool. only wish it had a visual indicator for caps lock.
customer_reviews.author: raymond

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless plug-in-play keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The slight elevation/ergonomics took a little to get used to but now I love it. I work from home and VERY MUCH prefer this keyboard over using the laptop keyboard; a matter I'm reminded of every time I travel.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: awesome keyboard. I wish it was back lit then I would be in heaven..

customer_reviews.title: I need a new USB for the wireless keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is still good after a year bit the USB is defective now. Anyone know how I can just replace the USB?????

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love the wireless part find the keyboard hard to type on am always making mistakes

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and the wireless keyboard is very convenient to use.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard! The curve is just enough, not too much. Would def recommend.

customer_reviews.title: Curve is a bit too weird. PC reports the USB Device has malfunctioned. Microsoft 5000 is better.
customer_reviews.text: Curve is a bit too weird. PC reports the USB Device has malfunctioned. Going back to my Microsoft 5000 keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: TECHFRANZ

customer_reviews.title: that one was awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Yeah . . . no. what happened to the comfort curve 2000? that one was awesome!
customer_reviews.author: fsmdox

customer_reviews.title: Love This Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Awesome keyboard. Slight curvature gives your hands a great position for speed. The touch is light, so again you can pick up your speed. Love this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: JY

product_meta.title: Microsoft Sculpt Comfort Keyboard
product_meta.description:
Comfortable, Productive, and Sleek. The Sculpt Comfort Keyboard not only looks great, it has a contoured keyset, cushioned palm rest and a palm lift to give you an amazingly comfortable typing experience. Plus, the innovative split spacebar with backspace functionality and Windows 8 hotkeys provide quick, easy access to the things you need most so you can get more done.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


MICROSOFT SCULPT COMFORT KEYBOARD
Contoured for comfort DESIGNED FOR COMFORT
The Sculpt Comfort Keyboard is packed with ergonomic features including a contoured keyset, removable padded palm rest, and palm lift. These features are designed to encourage a more natural, relaxed positioning of the arms, hands and wrist, providing greater comfort and helping to avoid injury during extended use.

BUILT FOR PRODUCTIVITY
Microsoft believes in the constant pursuit of excellence, and is always looking for ways to improve the comfort and productivity of our hardware. The new split spacebar with backspace functionality on the Sculpt Comfort Keyboard is the perfect example. Research shows that 90 percent of people use only their right thumb to hit the space bar, and that the backspace key is one of the most frequently used keys on a keyboard. Knowing this, Microsoft Hardware designers built a larger, split spacebar that includes a backspace bar on the left-hand side. The new design helps improve typing speed and provide improved comfort.

PERFECT FOR WINDOWS 8
The Sculpt Comfort Keyboard is equipped with hotkeys that give you one-touch access to some of the most commonly used functions in Windows 8, so you can search, share, or access your settings in the blink of an eye.

KEY FEATURES
 1. Contoured for comfort - Contoured design promotes a natural wrist position and puts keys within easy reach.
    
    
 2. Split spacebar with backspace functionality - Split spacebar with backspace functionality is designed to improve typing efficiency.
    
    
 3. Palm lift - Palm lift promotes a straight, neutral wrist position.
    
    
 4. Detachable palm rest - Detachable palm rest can be removed for a sleek, compact look.Work in the position that's most comfortable for you with detachable palm rest and adjustable keyboard legs.
    
    
 5. Cushioned palm rest - Cushioned palm rest provides support and promotes a neutral wrist position.
    
    


PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Windows 8 Shortcut Keys - Provides convenient access to commonly used Windows 8 functions.
 * Wireless Freedom - Give yourself room to move without worrying about tangled wires.


SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS
 * Computer/Operating System
   Windows 8, Windows 7, Windows Vista, Windows XP (excluding Windows XP 64-bit)
   
 * Hard Drive
   100 MB
 * Other
   USB
   2 AA alkaline battery required (included)
feature_bullets: Contoured design promotes a natural wrist position and puts keys within easy reach
Split spacebar with backspace functionality is designed to improve typing efficiency
Detachable palm rest can be removed for a sleek, compact look
Cushioned palm rest provides support and promotes a neutral wrist position
Palm lift promotes a straight, neutral wrist position
